title: The Chain Rule
text: Remember, the chain rule in Leibniz's notation tells us that $$\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{dy}{du} \frac{du}{dx}$$
speech: Remember, the chain rule in Leibniz's notation tells us that  fraction, d y, over, d x,  is equal to fraction, d y, over, d u,  fraction, d u, over, d x,
pacedSpeech: Remember, the chain rule in Leibniz's notation tells us that   fraction, d y, over, d x,  is equal to fraction, d y, over, d u,  fraction, d u, over, d x,

title: Decompose the Function
text: First we need to decompose our function $$y$$ into the form $$y=f(u)$$ and $$u=g(x)$$, try finding what f(u) and g(x) should be in this case!
speech: First we need to decompose our function  y  into the form  y, is equal to, f of u  and  u, is equal to g of x , try finding what f(u) and g(x) should be in this case!
pacedSpeech: First we need to decompose our function   y
into the form   y, is equal to, f of u
and   u, is equal to g of x
, try finding what f(u) and g(x) should be in this case!

title: Find the Derivative
text: Next, we take the derivative of f(u) in terms of u, $$\frac{dy}{du}$$, and the derivative of g(x) in terms of $$x$$, $$\frac{du}{dx}$$. Multiplying these two expressions together yields our final answer, dy/dx!
speech: Next, we take the derivative of f(u) in terms of u,  fraction, d y, over, d u,  , and the derivative of g(x) in terms of  x , , fraction, d u, over, d x,  . Multiplying these two expressions together yields our final answer, dy/dx!

, and the derivative of g(x) in terms of   x
,  , fraction, d u, over, d x,
. Multiplying these two expressions together yields our final answer, dy/dx!

title: Find $$\frac{dy}{du}$$
speech: What is  fraction, d y, over, d u,  ?
pacedSpeech: What is   fraction, d y, over, d u,

title: Find $$\frac{du}{dx}$$
speech: What is  fraction, d u, over, d x,  ?
pacedSpeech: What is   fraction, d u, over, d x,

title: Plug in
text: Finally, we only need to multiply these two expressions to find our final answer. Don't forget to plug in what we have for u in terms of $$x$$ into our final answer!
speech: Finally, we only need to multiply these two expressions to find our final answer. Don't forget to plug in what we have for u in terms of  x  into our final answer!
